author: Special Correspondent
text:
Did Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah slap an official during his visit to Ballari on Saturday to inaugurate a Valmiki Bhavan?

The issue became a matter of hot discussion after the electronic media reported that the Chief Minister allegedly slapped Municipal Commissioner Ramesh. However, both Mr. Ramesh and Chief Minister Siddaramaiah denied the incident.

The Chief Minister was coming to inaugurate the building and a large number of people had gathered to present him bouquets and garland him.

In the melee, Mr. Ramesh, who was being jostled by the crowd, was about to trip. Seeing this, the Chief Minister raised his hand.

Mr. Ramesh later told

The Hindu that he was with the Chief Minister to give details of the building when he was jostled by the crowd and was about to trip.

The Chief Minister might have raised his hand asking people around not to push, he said.

Before concluding his press conference, Mr. Siddaramaiah made a reference to the “incident” being telecast on TV and sought to know, “Whom did I slap?”
title: Official denies Siddaramaiah ‘slapped’ him
